title: 820-2850 green light no boot no fan spin ppbus_g3h 4v
message:
"17/18 resistance is 47 ohm."
Fix that first; check R7051/52 and traces.

title: 820-2850 green light no boot no fan spin ppbus_g3h 4v
message:
R7051 is replaced. now 17/18 resistance 3.5 ohm.

ppbus_g3h still 4v

title: 820-2850 green light no boot no fan spin ppbus_g3h 4v
message:
Check the R/C networks from pins 5, 7, 8.
Check/replace C7025.
Resolder entire ISL6259 area (surrounding components too).

title: 820-2850 green light no boot no fan spin ppbus_g3h 4v
message:
i have done this and now  ppbus_g3h is 12.2v.

Fan dont spin.

title: 820-2850 green light no boot no fan spin ppbus_g3h 4v
message: Post voltage and diode mode to ground at SCL/SDA lines of battery bus.

title: 820-2850 green light no boot no fan spin ppbus_g3h 4v
message: i think i accidentally touched something and blew up the ISL6259... pin 7 and pin 8 are now shorted to ground... ;/

title: 820-2850 green light no boot no fan spin ppbus_g3h 4v
message: can I replace ISL6259A with ISL6259 (non A)?

title: 820-2850 green light no boot no fan spin ppbus_g3h 4v
message:
SCL/SDA lines are easy available at battery connector.

Try, always when possible, to measure touching surrounding components of QFN chips.
Not a good idea to touch directly chip pins; is very easy to make short...

Yes, replace possible.
Before applying power, check no short present on board.
Pay atention to Q7030/35.

title: 820-2850 green light no boot no fan spin ppbus_g3h 4v
message:
how do i fix it? 

Also, how come yesterday I was getting  ppbus_g3h at 12.2v below i blow the ISL6259 and now after replacement it is 8.1v?

title: 820-2850 green light no boot no fan spin ppbus_g3h 4v
message:
Maybe bad ISL, or solders.
Check diode mode on SCL/SDA lines, w/ and w/o ISL6259 soldered.
Be sure R5280/81 are both good.

title: 820-2850 green light no boot no fan spin ppbus_g3h 4v
message: ah.. R5281 is shorted to ground.

title: 820-2850 green light no boot no fan spin ppbus_g3h 4v
message:
i checked pin 2 of D6950 is shorted to ground...i removed it to test, doesnt help.

I also removed C6953 to check, doesnt help. 

Bad SMC?

title: 820-2850 green light no boot no fan spin ppbus_g3h 4v
message:
Remove D6950 first.
If still short, remove U7000...

title: 820-2850 green light no boot no fan spin ppbus_g3h 4v
message: you are right.. short is gone after remove U7000...

title: 820-2850 green light no boot no fan spin ppbus_g3h 4v
message: Did you check both with red probe at ground?

title: 820-2850 green light no boot no fan spin ppbus_g3h 4v
message:
yes, actually not exactly pin 10 and pin 11 as the ISL6259 has been removed as per your instruction.

I measured these value at  R5280  and R5281 and diode mode show these value.. are they not normal?

title: 820-2850 green light no boot no fan spin ppbus_g3h 4v
message:
Less than 1% difference allowed.
Remove other components connected on that bus and check again.

title: 820-2850 green light no boot no fan spin ppbus_g3h 4v
message:
the diode mode value of pin 10 seems to be correct as I cross checked with a good board.

the other components on the pin 11 bus seems to be only: J6950 , J6955, C6953 (removed), D6950 (removed), R5281(resistance value is good and same as R5280) and the SMC

Did I miss anything?

title: 820-2850 green light no boot no fan spin ppbus_g3h 4v
message:
Pin 11 has too high reading; supposing you measured with red probe at ground.
So is not the case to remove something from that line.
Your problem is a broken trace, or bad solder at SMC probably, or U7000.

title: 820-2850 green light no boot no fan spin ppbus_g3h 4v
message:
Yes but you told me to remove the U7000 already... so with U7000 out, those are the reading from pin 10 and pin 11 and you said less than 1% difference allowed. 

When you said "Remove other components connected on that bus", were you refering to components that are attached to pin 10 or pin 11?

title: 820-2850 green light no boot no fan spin ppbus_g3h 4v
message:
You have a higher value than expected on the SCL line.
In such case should be broken line, or bad solder.
But high value can be normal if both SMC and U7000 are removed.
If at least one is on the board, the value should be around 550-700, like you have on SDA.

If none (SMC, or U7000) are soldered, then maybe SDA line has problems, because should be higher in such case.
Then you can suspect a component with leakage.

How ever, you should check disconnecting J6955 and may need to remove C6952/53 (if present).

title: 820-2850 green light no boot no fan spin ppbus_g3h 4v
message: i have removed both SMC and U7000, now both pin 10 and pin 11 are high value around 1087

title: 820-2850 green light no boot no fan spin ppbus_g3h 4v
message: Now start resoldering the components one by one, and check the values each time.
